Model

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • Model.Board

  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    Keeps track of a board with multiple fields in it.
    Author:
    peter

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Board()
      Makes a new board filled with empty fields.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Board copy()
      Makes a copy of the current board
      int diagonalStoneCount(int player, int amount)
      Counts the amount of times that given amount of stones of given player are diagonal to eachother without interruption by an empty field or another players stones on a diagonal line.
      boolean diagonalWinner(int player)
      Checks if the board has a diagonal line of STONES stones for the given player.
      void doMove(int column, int player)
      Places a stone by the given player in the given column on the board.
      int horizontalStoneCount(int player, int amount)
      Counts the amount of times that given amount of stones of given player are next to eachother without interruption by an empty field or another players stones on a horizontal line.
      boolean horizontalWinner(int player)
      Checks if the board has a horizontal line of STONES stones for the given player.
      boolean isBoardFull()
      Determines if the board is full or empty
      int isFiledWith(int column, int row)
      Tells the caller if the given field is filled by player 1 or player 2 or is still empty.
      boolean legalMove(int column)
      Checks the board if the move in the given column is a valid move.
      int nextEmptyRowInColumn(int column)
      Gives the bottommost row that is empty in the given column.
      int verticalStoneCount(int player, int amount)
      Counts the amount of times that given amount of stones of given player are next to eachother without interruption by an empty field or another players stones on a vertical line.
      boolean verticalWinner(int player)
      Checks if the board has a vertical line of STONES stones for the given player.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Board

        public Board()
        Makes a new board filled with empty fields.

    • Method Detail

      • legalMove

        public boolean legalMove(int column)
        Checks the board if the move in the given column is a valid move.
        Parameters:
        column - => 0 && column <= COLUMNS - 1
        Returns:
        If true then the move is legalEMPTY, if false then the move is illegal.

      • doMove

        public void doMove(int column,
                   int player)
        Places a stone by the given player in the given column on the board.
        Parameters:
        column - => 0 && column <= COLUMNS - 1
        player - == 1 || player == 2

      • horizontalWinner

        public boolean horizontalWinner(int player)
        Checks if the board has a horizontal line of STONES stones for the given player.
        Parameters:
        player - == 1 || player == 2
        Returns:
        If true then the board has a winner for the given player with a horizontal line, if false then the board has no winner for the given player with a horizontal line.

      • verticalWinner

        public boolean verticalWinner(int player)
        Checks if the board has a vertical line of STONES stones for the given player.
        Parameters:
        player - == 1 || player == 2
        Returns:
        If true then the board has a winner for the given player with a vertical line, if false then the board has no winner for the given player with a vertical line.

      • diagonalWinner

        public boolean diagonalWinner(int player)
        Checks if the board has a diagonal line of STONES stones for the given player.
        Parameters:
        player - == 1 || player == 2
        Returns:
        If true then the board has a winner for the given player with a diagonal line, if false then the board has no winner for the given player with a diagonal line.

      • nextEmptyRowInColumn

        public int nextEmptyRowInColumn(int column)
        Gives the bottommost row that is empty in the given column. And returns 6 if the column is filled completely.
        Parameters:
        column - >= 0 && column <= COLUMNS - 1
        Returns:
        >= 0 && return <= 6

      • isBoardFull

        public boolean isBoardFull()
        Determines if the board is full or empty
        Returns:
        If true then the board is full, if false then the board has no winner for the given player with a diagonal line.

      • isFiledWith

        public int isFiledWith(int column,
                       int row)
        Tells the caller if the given field is filled by player 1 or player 2 or is still empty.
        Parameters:
        column - >= 0 && column <= COLUMNS - 1
        row - >= 0 && row <= ROWS - 1
        Returns:
        is 0 if empty, is 1 if player 1 fills the field, is 2 if player 2 fills the field

      • copy

        public Board copy()
        Makes a copy of the current board
        Returns:
        a new Board that has the same values as the current board

      • horizontalStoneCount

        public int horizontalStoneCount(int player,
                                int amount)
        Counts the amount of times that given amount of stones of given player are next to eachother without interruption by an empty field or another players stones on a horizontal line.
        Parameters:
        player - is the player for who the stones are counted
        amount - is the amount of stones that are to be counted on one horizontal row
        Returns:
        the number of times a row of the given player with a given amount of stones is found

      • verticalStoneCount

        public int verticalStoneCount(int player,
                              int amount)
        Counts the amount of times that given amount of stones of given player are next to eachother without interruption by an empty field or another players stones on a vertical line.
        Parameters:
        player - is the player for who the stones are counted
        amount - is the amount of stones that are to be counted on one vertical row
        Returns:
        the number of times a row of the given player with a given amount of stones is found

      • diagonalStoneCount

        public int diagonalStoneCount(int player,
                              int amount)
        Counts the amount of times that given amount of stones of given player are diagonal to eachother without interruption by an empty field or another players stones on a diagonal line.
        Parameters:
        player - is the player for who the stones are counted
        amount - is the amount of stones that are to be counted on one diagonal row
        Returns:
        the number of times a row of the given player with a given amount of stones is found
